name: Tayba Foundation
mission:
Tayba aims to become a pioneer—the first to offer a complete, high-quality online curriculum featuring engaging visual and audio instruction Our programs SOURCE: Self-reported by organization What are the organization's current programs, how do they measure success,
            and who do the programs serve? Education At Tayba, we believe that character reformation gives incarcerated clients and the formerly incarcerated the tools they need to successfully reintegrate into society following parole.
theoryOfChange: Tayba Foundation outlines its strategic approach through its 'Programs' section, detailing how its activities lead to impact. The organization states its belief in 'human potential' and aims to help clients 'acquire the tools needed to unlock human potential and forge a healthy future' through 'thoughtful, well-designed programs'. Their approach is centered on three core components: Education, Life Skills, and Reentry. The curriculum is specifically designed for 'character reformation' and focuses on the emotional, mental, spiritual, and social development of incarcerated individuals to enable their reintegration into society. Furthermore, Tayba Foundation employs 'evidence-based parole plans' and provides 'coaching and peer-mentoring' as part of its reentry support. The organization also publishes 'Our Goals for 2021,' which details specific objectives for their programs, indicating a structured approach to achieving their mission. A third-party source also highlights Tayba Foundation's belief in 'the power of human change through holistic education, guidance, and support' and notes that their work helps prisoners become less violent, aids in their transition to the outside world, and lowers recidivism rates.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization has a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised.
Tayba Foundation is zakat-eligible and maintains a specific policy for zakat distribution among asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $1,460,391 and a program expense ratio of 84.6%.
Tayba offers a complete online curriculum for incarcerated clients to support character reformation and successful reintegration.
The foundation offers various donation options including company matching programs.
The organization provides opportunities for volunteer engagement and board service.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Tayba Foundation earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial accountability and efficient use of donor funds. Its specialized focus on prisoner education and re-entry provides a unique and necessary service within the community.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding the directness of impact beyond capacity building to further lower the cost per beneficiary.
Increasing donor alignment for those seeking high-urgency domestic poverty interventions.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Tayba Foundation is highly aligned with Islamic giving principles, maintaining a dedicated zakat policy and distribution process [2]. While it serves a medium-fit donor profile, its work addresses critical domestic needs related to the justice system and education [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high effectiveness by allocating 84.6% of its expenses to programs, resulting in a cost per beneficiary of approximately $511.54 [1][3]. Its focus on non-recidivism through character reformation and life skills training provides a structured pathway for successful societal reintegration [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: Tayba Foundation provides holistic education and re-entry support to incarcerated individuals to facilitate successful reintegration into society.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.6%, ensuring the majority of funds directly support educational and re-entry services.
Strong financial health with 6.7 months of working capital and a low fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised.
Verified zakat-eligible status with a clear distribution process for eligible asnaf categories.
baseline_narrative.summary: Tayba Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to character reformation through a comprehensive online curriculum featuring visual and audio instruction for incarcerated and formerly incarcerated clients [4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $1,460,391 and maintains a high level of financial transparency with a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100 [1][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Tayba Foundation earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial accountability and efficient use of donor funds. Its specialized focus on prisoner education and re-entry provides a unique and necessary service within the community.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization is zakat-eligible, it could <cite id="2">clarify specific zakat allocation policies</cite> to help donors better understand how funds are partitioned between different asnaf categories.
The current <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary is approximately $511.54</cite>; expanding direct service delivery could help lower this metric as the organization scales.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high governance standards with a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The high cost is mitigated by the intensive nature of the educational curriculum and the significant long-term savings to society from zero recidivism.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Cost per beneficiary of $511.54</cite> may be high for some donors
case_against.summary: Limited concerns primarily relate to the <cite id="1">niche focus</cite> and the <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary</cite> which is higher than large-scale international relief efforts.

confidence.notes: Strong alignment between financial filings and third-party ratings.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> and serves <cite id="2">four specific asnaf categories</cite> including the poor and those in bondage.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="2">clarifying zakat allocation policies</cite> and eligible use categories for donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Tayba due to its <cite id="1">94.94.25/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and its <cite id="3">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could publish more frequent <cite id="4">independent impact evaluations</cite> to supplement its internal recidivism data.

impact.explanation: Operations are efficient with a <cite id="1">84.6% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="4">100% non-recidivism rate</cite> among participants.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be strengthened by <cite id="3">tracking more than two outcome metrics</cite> consistently over a longer time horizon.

rich_narrative.headline: Tayba Foundation provides holistic education and re-entry support to incarcerated individuals to facilitate successful reintegration into society.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support the spiritual and social rehabilitation of incarcerated Muslims in the US through a highly accountable, zakat-eligible institution.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through the 'riqab' asnaf category
Believe in the power of education to transform lives and reduce crime
Value high transparency and third-party ratings (Charity Navigator 94.25/100)
Prefer supporting domestic US-based Muslim causes
giving_considerations: Gifts support long-term educational programs rather than immediate emergency relief
The organization operates in a niche space with high specialized costs
Impact is measured through long-term behavioral changes like non-recidivism
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who prioritize the lowest possible cost-per-meal metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks <cite id="3">two key outcome metrics</cite> and reports a <cite id="4">100% non-recidivism rate</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Tayba uses Islamic education and life skills training to reform character and provide the tools necessary for successful reentry, thereby eliminating recidivism.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence in the prison sector is vital to prove that educational interventions actually reduce the likelihood of returning to crime.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">revenue of $1.46M</cite> and a vast population of incarcerated Muslims in the US, there is significant room to scale operations.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="4">exclusive focus on the incarcerated population</cite> and its <cite id="1">high accountability scores</cite> compared to smaller domestic peers.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses more on prison visitation and mentorship

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 84.6%</cite> and a highly efficient <cite id="1">fundraising cost of $0.18 per $1 raised</cite>.
Tayba holds a <cite id="1">94.25/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned the <cite id="3">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
The foundation reports a <cite id="4">100% non-recidivism rate</cite> for its students, significantly outperforming national averages.

strengths_deep_dive: Tayba Foundation's operational strength is rooted in its lean financial model and specialized focus. With <cite id="1">6.7 months of working capital</cite>, the organization is financially resilient and capable of sustaining its programs through economic fluctuations. Its governance is bolstered by a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>, ensuring that oversight remains objective and mission-aligned. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated consistent growth with a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 11.2%</cite>, indicating increasing donor trust and expanding capacity to serve the incarcerated population across the United States.
rich_narrative.summary: Tayba Foundation is a specialized non-profit organization dedicated to the character reformation and holistic education of incarcerated individuals in the United States. The organization provides a <cite id="4">comprehensive online curriculum featuring visual and audio instruction</cite> designed to facilitate successful reintegration into society. With a <cite id="1">Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100</cite>, Tayba Foundation demonstrates a high level of institutional maturity and financial accountability. The foundation's primary mission addresses the spiritual and educational needs of Muslim inmates, a demographic often underserved by mainstream correctional programming. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,460,391</cite>, which supports a diverse range of programs including Islamic education, life skills, and reentry support. A key differentiator for the foundation is its remarkable <cite id="4">non-recidivism rate of 100%</cite> among its tracked participants, suggesting that its educational interventions are highly effective at breaking the cycle of incarceration. The organization maintains a <cite id="1">perfect 100 score in both Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator, reflecting a robust internal governance structure and strategic clarity. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible entity</cite>, Tayba Foundation provides a critical avenue for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations by supporting the 'riqab' (those in bondage) and 'fuqara' (the poor) asnaf categories within the American prison system.
